intro: Maughania strobilifera f. rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered form of the Maughania strobilifera, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, red-orange ray florets that contrast with its yellow disk flowers, making it visually distinctive. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and specialized collections.
